Class CourseList

  • java.lang.Object
    • CourseList

  • public class CourseList
extends java.lang.Object
    Custom linked list that is capable of holding a course, next in the list of that course and the next course that is in the same semester as that course.
    Author:
    Yasir

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private CourseNode currentNode
      Current element when iterating using next and nextInSemester methods
      private boolean firstCall
      Describes if the first call of iteration is being made
      private CourseNode head
      Starting element of the list
      private int size
      Number of elements in the list

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CourseList()
      Simple constructor, sets the start as null, current node as the starting node and the size as 0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Course crs)
      Adds a course at the end of the list.
      Course get(int index)
      getter for an element of the list based on index values
      Course next()
      pushes the currentNode by one index and and returns the value that is at the currentNode
      Course nextInSemester()
      pushes the currentNode to the element that is in the same semester as the currentNode and first after it.
      void printListInOrder()
      Prints all elements in the linked list starting from the first and ending at size-1
      void printListUsingNextSemester(int semester)
      Prints all elements that are in the given semester using the nextSemester method
      void remove(int index)
      Removes and element in the list based on the index value.
      int size()
      Getter for the size field

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • head

        private CourseNode head
        Starting element of the list

      • currentNode

        private CourseNode currentNode
        Current element when iterating using next and nextInSemester methods

      • size

        private int size
        Number of elements in the list

      • firstCall

        private boolean firstCall
        Describes if the first call of iteration is being made

    • Constructor Detail

      • CourseList

        public CourseList()
        Simple constructor, sets the start as null, current node as the starting node and the size as 0

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        Getter for the size field
        Returns:
        number of elements in the list

      • add

        public void add(Course crs)
        Adds a course at the end of the list. Finds its nextInSemester value and a value that is before this element that has the same semester as this, constructs the links between those.
        Parameters:
        crs - course to be added

      • get

        public Course get(int index)
        getter for an element of the list based on index values
        Parameters:
        index - which index in the list is trying to be get
        Returns:
        the element that is at the given list

      • next

        public Course next()
        pushes the currentNode by one index and and returns the value that is at the currentNode
        Returns:
        the value of the node after the currentNode

      • nextInSemester

        public Course nextInSemester()
        pushes the currentNode to the element that is in the same semester as the currentNode and first after it.
        Returns:
        the value of the node after the currentNode that is in the same semester.

      • remove

        public void remove(int index)
        Removes and element in the list based on the index value. Fixes the links before and after this element so the flow of the list stays the same.
        Parameters:
        index - which index needs to be removed

      • printListInOrder

        public void printListInOrder()
        Prints all elements in the linked list starting from the first and ending at size-1

      • printListUsingNextSemester

        public void printListUsingNextSemester(int semester)
        Prints all elements that are in the given semester using the nextSemester method
        Parameters:
        semester - the semester of the courses that needs to be printed
